grammarNote.title: Desire: たい
grammarNote.explanation:
たい attaches to a verb stem and expresses wanting. 助けたい — want to help. 水を取りたい — want to take the water. 水を出したい — want to get the water out.

たい behaves like an い-adjective: it sits at the end, no だ needed. And it only expresses the speaker's own desire.

Re-read and notice: who says たい, and what do they want?

vocabulary.meaning: to take out, put out, send
